messages.message: Thank you for connecting, I have a question for you about iOS.
Hey Brian, pleasure to meet you. What's up?
I am curious what you would use to apply a "theme" to an iOS app. Do you use the appearance feature built in to swift? Similar code for different size screens? Text color, heading color, etc.

https://www.raywenderlich.com/108766/uiappearance-tutorial
, a note about that tutorial is that I don't think it's converted to Swift 3.0

Cool.  I tried the CSS media queries but there is so much overhead for something so simple!  Would you be interested in the plugin I wrote that makes heavy use of generics?  It's only 2 drop in files, very easy to read, it kind adds CSS style options but allows you to address any class type in hierarchy.
Wow, GitHub is down right now.
